name: decked
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
deck
deck verb [T]
(DECORATE)
to decorate or add something to something to make an effect: The room was decked with flowers. The wedding guests were decked out in their finery (= wearing their best clothes). See also
bedeck literary

deck verb [T]
(HIT)
slang to hit someone, especially to hit someone and knock them down: Do that again and I'll deck you.
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to hit someone or somethinghitShe was expelled for hitting another pupil.whackShe whacked the water with her paddle.bashThe swinging door bashed him in the face.strikeShe had been struck on the head with a golf ball.beatHe was cruel to his dog and beat it with a stick.punchHe punched me in the stomach.
